events.name: monsters__TimerIsOn
events.comment: True (1) when the monsters' respawn timer is activated. This is False (0) when there is already the maximum amount of monsters on a map.

children.text: Destroy signal coming from other peers
Load monsters from the cipher made available by the host

children.name: spawnstate
children.comment: Shortname for accessing the spawnState value.

children.name: respawntimer
children.comment: Shortname for accessing the RespawnTimer value.

children.name: groupcount
children.comment: Shortname for accessing the GroupCount value.

children.text: Loop through all the existing tokens of the AJAX data, ignoring the first 3, and store them into the temp variable. Then, reencode the shortened data.

actions.text: Don't forget to remove last "|" char

parameters: "Monsters Photon cipher property updated to : "&Functions.Enigma_Decrypt(Photon.PropertyOfMyRoom("MonstersCipher"), K_BROWSER)

children.comment: Shortname for accessing the MonsterGroupHashID value.

actions.text: Increment the MonsterCount token of the Photon cipher property ("|" token 0)

"Monsters Photon cipher property updated to : "&Functions.Enigma_Decrypt(Photon.PropertyOfMyRoom("MonstersCipher"), K_BROWSER)

children.functionDescription: Push an update from the host client to the cipher. Potentially push manual string of encrypted data. Otherwise, rely on internal logic of the program to fetch values (like coordinates) and update the cipher.
Unload the Photon room property "MonstersCipher"'s data to refresh the display of the client.
Load display data from the MonstersCipher Photon property and actualized peer clients.
Spawn a monster group based on the property corresponding to the hashID.
Spawn all monster groups corresponding to the current state of the "Monsters cipher".

functionParameters.name: pMonsterGroupHashID
functionParameters.comment: Hash ID to associate with the created monster group.

functionParameters.name: pAnimatorCore
functionParameters.comment: Animator core to set the MonsterLeader to.

children.functionDescription: Bind existing monsters according to their GroupHashID parentage.
Request the spawn data from the php frontdesk.

actions.text: Request a spawnState at the php Frontdesk. The spawnState will be accompanied by a spawn data cipher to create monsters that have been already spawned.
APPID and BK as usual (BK only for logging the user sessionkey)

children.functionDescription: Request the respawn timer from the php frontdesk.

children.functionDescription: Checks with the server if a new monster group can be spawned and return a signal to the client accordingly.

functionParameters.name: pX
functionParameters.comment: Encrypted X-coordinate to spawn the monster at.

functionParameters.name: pY
functionParameters.comment: Encrypted Y-coordinate to spawn the monster at.

children.functionDescription: Request to deal damage to a monster to the php frontdesk and return a signal to the client accordingly.
